intro: Bobua somae, commonly known as the Somalian bobua, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its restricted habitat and threats from environmental degradation, Bobua somae is considered endangered.
